intro: Baloskion tetraphyllum subsp. meiostachyum, commonly known as the Four-branch Baloskion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb with a creeping stem and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Apiaceae family.
